page.title: 03Buildings in Clifton
page.content: The oldest houses in Clifton date back to the 16th century,but the greatest development has taken place within the last 150 years. The cottages in Avon Street and Spoil Bank Hill, were built to accommodate the railway workers originally. There were two public houses The Bull and the Red Lion. The latter has now been replaced by the Townsend Memorial Hall, but The Bull is still in existance. It was probably built during the 18th century and was used not only as an inn, but also as a court of law. The church is over 900 years old and has been added to during that time. We hear that in the 16th century, the people of "Clifton super Dunesmore sold ye church byble to buy a bayre."This was legend not fact.
